name: the handsome chris pullover
notes:
this pattern is simply a replica of a sweater from the knives out movie, reverse engineered for funsies in 10 sizes with 2 sleeve width options. it is a drop shoulder pullover, knit in pieces and seamed.

skill level                                
intermediate to experienced. must know basic garment construction, seaming, knitting in the round, following charts, knitting cables (with or without a cable needle.) at this point, many people have used this as their first sweater project, so don't let me tell you what to do! :)

needles
a us 5 and a us 7 needle, circs or straights for the body. you’ll need a size 5 circ for knitting in the round on the collar, and a cable needle if that’s how you roll. but really just learn how to cable without a cable needle. your life will be much better when you do.

yarn
~2,500 yards of white dk or worsted weight yarn **for xl**. i’m using blue moon fiber arts targhee worsted in snowflake, but i would encourage you to use any worsted weight yarn you like.


finished measurements 
sleeves: see instructions for customization.
sizes: xs, (s, m, l,) xl, 2xl, 3xl, 4xl, 5xl, 6xl 
chest circumference: 36, (40, 44, 48,) 52, 56, 60, 64, 68, 72” 
width at the bottom hem: 17, (19, 21, 23,) 25, 27, 29, 31, 33, 35" 
body length: 23, (24, 25, 26,) 27, 28, 29, x, x, x”  - see notes on knitting this sweater to fit the length you would like.
